title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
U.S. consumers increased spending briskly at retailers last month, while employers largely resisted laying off workers, in the latest sign the economy is proving resilient against the Delta variant of the coronavirus.

---

Federal prosecutors plan to criminally charge a former Boeing pilot they suspect of misleading aviation regulators about safety issues blamed for two fatal crashes of the 737 MAX.

---

The World Bank canceled a report rating the business environment of the world's countries after an inquiry concluded that senior bank management pressured staff to alter data affecting the ranking of China and other nations.

---

Ernie Garcia II, the father of Carvana's CEO, has since October sold more than $3.6 billion of stock, amounting to 16% of his holdings in the company.

---

Invesco is in talks to merge with State Street's asset-management business, people familiar with the matter said.

---

The S&P 500 and Dow both fell 0.2%, while the Nasdaq gained 0.1%.

---

The Fed is looking at placing new curbs on the financial activities of its policy makers after disclosures on trading by the leaders of two of its regional banks.

---

A MassMutual unit agreed to pay a $4 million fine to settle a Massachusetts inquiry into the social-media and trading activity of its employees, including GameStop investor Keith Gill.
